definition: bond (esp. document split in two, with each party holding one half)/contract/deed (i.e. title deeds)/ticket/voucher/certificate

sentences.english: Well, I have some store scrip I would like to use.
sentences.chinese: 嗯，我有一些商店购物券想拿来用。

sentences.english: Some homemakers make a hobby of collecting coupons.
sentences.chinese: 有些家庭主妇有收集购物券的嗜好。

sentences.english: This includes using manufacturer's coupons if I have them available.
sentences.chinese: 这包括使用商家提供的购物券。

sentences.english: A gift card to her favorite pharmacy is a great idea.
sentences.chinese: 一张来自她最爱的药店的购物券也是个不错的主意。

sentences.english: Do I really need to fret over the fact that Bass didn't take my expired coupons?
sentences.chinese: 难道真地有必要商场不收我的过期购物券而烦恼吗？

definition: to exchange for (sth of equal value or utility)/to use in lieu/to redeem (a coupon etc)/to use to offset (an amount owed etc)
bond (esp. document split in two, with each party holding one half)/contract/deed (i.e. title deeds)/ticket/voucher/certificate
(Tw) to put money into (a stored-value card or pre-paid phone account)/to top up
to draw a prize/a lottery/a raffle
store credit (credit to be spent at a specified retailer)
